original: Unlike other large U.S. airlines which mostly use hub-and-spoke systems, Southwest uses point-to-point operations and underwent a massive crew scheduling "meltdown" because most of its pilots and flight attendants were out of position, which resulted in massive numbers of flight cancellations persisting for days after the worst weather had subsided and other airlines had largely recovered.
simplified: Unlike other major U.S. airlines, Southwest operates point-to-point flights. || When severe weather hit, the majority of Southwest's pilots and flight attendants were out of position. || This caused a massive crew scheduling issue. || The result was days of many flight cancellations, even after the weather had calmed down and other airlines were back on track.

original: Slovenian point guard, Luka Doncic of the Dallas Mavericks, scores the first 60-point triple-double in the National Basketball Association, the premier men's professional basketball league in the world, after recording 60 points, 21 rebounds, and 10 assists in the Mavericks' 126–121 overtime win against the New York Knicks in Dallas.
